clinical_study.brief_title: Isthmocele After Endometrial and Non-endometrial Suturing in Cesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: Isthmocele After Endometrial and Non-endometrial Suturing in Cesarean Section

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares the effect of two techniques of uterine closure, with or without endometrial suturing on isthmocele development after cesarean section.

detailed_description.textblock: Cesarean section is the most common surgery performed on pregnant women. Poor healing of the incision of the uterus leads to isthmocele development. Long-term morbidities associated with isthmocele are uterine scar pregnancy, uterine perforation, pelvic pain, and spotting-style bleeding after menstruation. Many factors that may affect the healing of uterine scar have been studied in the literature (i.e. Double or single-layer closure, locked or unlocked closure, uterine retroflection). Suturing complete fold of the wound lips during the closure of the uterus may cause the endometrial layer to be embedded in the myometrium and to form niche tissue. The study hypothesized that isthmocele development can be reduced by suturing without enclosing the endometrium during uterine closure.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Closure of the hysterotomy at the time of primary cesarean section

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with isthmocele six month after cesarean section
primary_outcome.description: Residual myometrium thickness of less then 2.5 mm with transvaginal ultrasonography
Myometrial thickness measured at incision site with transvaginal ultrasonography

secondary_outcome.description: The rate of spotting complains of patients

arm_group.description: The uterus will be sewn with full fold locked sutures that pass through myometrium and endometrium.
The uterus will be sewn with locked sutures that pass through myometrium without endometrium.

intervention.intervention_name: Closure of the uterus with endometrium at the time of cesarean
intervention.description: Closure of the uterus at the time of primary cesarean will be performed with suturing the endometrium.

intervention.intervention_name: Closure of the uterus without endometrium at the time of cesarean
intervention.description: Closure of the uterus at the time of primary cesarean will be performed without suturing the endometrium.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Term pregnancy (≥37 weeks of gestation)
- Singleton pregnancy
- Primary cesarean
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous cesarean section
- Previous uterine surgery
- Multiple gestations
- Mullerian anomalies
- Active labor
- Placenta previa/accreta
